page.title: 09OUR STUDY AREA
page.content: The area covered by the three kilometre squares of Kilnhurst Church of England School is mainly farmland. It is an area used for agriculture with evidence of five farms and out- buildings still standing today. There is a small amount of woodland and two disused stone quarries as well as a reservoir. Several minor roads cover the area and run from north to south and east to west. The landscape is very uneven and rises from a height of seventy five feet to over two hundred and fifty feet above sea-level. All the farm buildings are built from the local stone and may have come from the disused quarries in the area. There is no livestock on the farms and all the land is used for growing crops. One point of interest is an osier. This was an area used for growing willow for basketwork.
